intro: Pseudopimpinella anthriscoides var. cruciata, commonly known as the broad-leaved cow parsley, is a perennial herb native to southern Europe and parts of North Africa. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, characterized by its umbellate inflorescence and aromatic foliage. The plant features compound leaves with a distinctive pinnate structure, and its flowers are typically white or pale yellow. It thrives in moist, calcareous soils and is often found in meadows and woodland edges. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
